A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
It tries too hard to be 3\, 5\, and 6\, but forgets its 8. I had never been more solely disapointed in a star wars film since episode 2. Not only does it NOT feel like Star Wars\, it just feels like the guardians of the galaxy 2.3.
Powerful moments ruined by awkward comedy. Very confusing character motives\, and a confusing story made me want to walk out of the middle of the film. It drags itself so hard it made me wish it ended faster.
I will no longer excuse it like i did for episode 7. It feels more like a remake than episode 7. I hold high standards for star wars and this movie was low par.

I did like the special effects and the action was great\, but in my opinion\, SE only represents 1 star of any movie\, the other 4 needs to be earned by story and music\, which\, music ques and scores represent the half star of this review.

Important characters are killed off for no reason when they could be used in future installments\, and as much as i love Mark's comedic scenes\, 50% feel out of place.

I can go on and on about how this movie failed me as a die hard Star wars fanatic\, but if i did\, it would crash the internet. So\, the end. I'm not seeing this movie a second time.
